thread.title: European Parliament calls for recognition of Palestine - Telegraph
thread.title_full: European Parliament calls for recognition of Palestine - Telegraph

author: Eliza Hajzeri
title: European Parliament calls for recognition of Palestine - Telegraph
text:
European Parliament calls for recognition of Palestine
The EU Assembly voted in favor of a non-binding resolution, agreed by the center-majority groups.
The European Parliament adopted a resolution calling on EU member states to "consider recognizing the State of Palestine, with a view to achieving a two-state solution."
While Parliament has supported "recognition in principle of Palestinian statehood" in the past, this new resolution appears to be a more direct call for national governments to act.
The resolution was approved with 305 votes in favor, 151 against and 122 abstentions.
According to Italian Socialist MEP Nicola Zingaretti, this was the result of thorough negotiations between political groups on various amendments.
The vote was long and tense, and members of Parliament even requested a pause to check the votes on the amendments on Gaza, before continuing with the final vote on the resolution as a whole.
Another controversial point in the resolution was the use of the term "genocide" to describe Israel's attacks on Gaza.
The wording "genocidal acts" was ultimately rejected and excluded from the text. /Telegraph/
